channel.title: Caches on The blog of Zhixuan
channel.description: Recent content in Caches on The blog of Zhixuan

item.title: Data, too much, too soon
item.description:
Recently I have a very sharp idea change about my data.

Like for years, maybe more precisely, from I was in high school, I have been taking regular notes about my mental state. Well, to be honest, it’s a strange behaviour, it’s like if you are healthy everyday you don’t need no record. Or you don’t need to take notes on the level of back pain if you don’t have any. I take notes on mental states because I absolutely feel abnormal, feel I’m so different from other people (the most stupid thing is that I’ve gone though like 24 years without a proper idea of my ADHD traits, while maybe a bit knowledge about my ASD personality), but was actually treated and required as the normal people concept.

item.title: Setting up ssh key for github
item.description:
You know ssh key? No I don’t.

Only used it once on a parallel computing class and nevermore. You know a 和蔼小老头 who has been hired form a Tokyo Univerity associate professor position. Sometimes I even doubt that you get bald and a big belly after years of coding experience. In his class we are required to get access to the university super computer. To get authorized, ssh keys are used to grant our personal computers to the gurdian at the door.

item.title: My university experience with latex and markdown
item.description:
I’ve been writing in LaTeX since my undergraduate years, and the things I learned from school about that is never enough.

Wanna type your own ideas on a computer? You’ve got many choices for the softwares, like the classical choice, Microsoft Word, which goes so graphical that even a nerd can perform 80% of its functionality. Personally I prefer Markdown, a simple programming language but with considerable power. In my sophomore year I’m a dickhead, only received a lecture on C programming for one semister and never have enough concentration to dive deeper, but I can write markdown.
